hints.content:
Max started with $\goldE{60}$ balloons.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/a7d111f00e6b3caf1ca74e3c56b0bb41c996a205)

To subtract on the number line, we jump to the **left**.

He gave away $\maroonD{15}$ balloons to his friend.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/40baaa6099476657a88681231fe2f485e077e0e2)

$\goldE{60} - \maroonD{15} = 45$

Then he gave away $\purpleD{15}$ balloons to his sister.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/b7d7514a12d499526dd82e33dce4f2e4362431f5)

$45 - \purpleD{15} =30$

Last, he gave $\blueE{11}$ balloons to his dog.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/08812de35371b6b1d755f07c9bac96be862b780e)

$30 - \blueE{11} = 19$

Here is the correct number line:

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/da4a6100ff5fce67b7aeabcf018a1ae419795aee)

Max had ${19}$ balloons left.

question.content:
For his birthday, Max had $60$ balloons.  

He gave $15$ balloons to a friend, $15$ balloons to his sister, and $11$ balloon to a dog.         

**Which number line shows how to find how many balloons Max has left?**

[[☃ radio 1]]  

**How many balloons does Max have left?**

[[☃ numeric-input 1]] balloons
